extendedIngredients.name: basmati rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups basmati rice (or other long-grain rice), rinsed until water runs clear

extendedIngredients.name: cilantro leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves and fine stems

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: low sodium chicken broth
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 2/3 cups low-sodium homemade or store bought chicken broth

extendedIngredients.name: red chilies
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 dried hot red chilies (such as chile de arbol)

extendedIngredients.name: whole chicken
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces (2 thighs, 2 drumsticks, 4 breast pieces), or 2 pounds mixed chicken pieces
metaInformation: cut into 8 pieces (2 thighs, 2 drumsticks, 4 breast pieces), or 2 pounds  chicken pieces

recipes.title: Chicken and Rice With Almonds and Dried Cherries

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Season chicken generously with salt and pepper. Heat butter in a large pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat until foaming subsides, swirling pan gently. Add as much of the chicken as will comfortably fit in one layer, skin-side down. Cook until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Flip and brown on the other side, another 3 minutes. Set browned chicken pieces aside and, if necessary, repeat process with remaining chicken.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            Remove all but 3 tablespoons of fat. Add cinnamon stick and cook until fragrant, about 10 seconds. Add onion and cook, stirring often to dislodge any browned bits, until lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add almonds and cook until lightly toasted, about 1 minute. Add dried cherries and dried red chilies and cook for 1 minute more, stirring often.                                                                                                                             3                                                                            Stir in rice and cook until the grains turn a chalky white, about 1 minute. Add the broth, season with a 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, nestle the chicken pieces on top, cover, and cook until the rice is fluffy and the chicken pieces are fully cooked, 20 to 25 minutes.                                                                                                                             4                                                                            Garnish chicken and rice with cilantro and mint. Serve with lemon and hot sauce of your choice.

steps.step: Season chicken generously with salt and pepper.
Heat butter in a large pot or dutch oven over medium-high heat until foaming subsides, swirling pan gently.

Add as much of the chicken as will comfortably fit in one layer, skin-side down. Cook until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Flip and brown on the other side, another 3 minutes. Set browned chicken pieces aside and, if necessary, repeat process with remaining chicken.
Remove all but 3 tablespoons of fat.
Add cinnamon stick and cook until fragrant, about 10 seconds.
Add onion and cook, stirring often to dislodge any browned bits, until lightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes.
Add almonds and cook until lightly toasted, about 1 minute.
Add dried cherries and dried red chilies and cook for 1 minute more, stirring often.
Stir in rice and cook until the grains turn a chalky white, about 1 minute.

Add the broth, season with a 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, nestle the chicken pieces on top, cover, and cook until the rice is fluffy and the chicken pieces are fully cooked, 20 to 25 minutes.
Garnish chicken and rice with cilantro and mint.
Serve with lemon and hot sauce of your choice.
